label: Object Name
helperText: name of the object

label: Default Service account
helperText:
Service account is used by the cartographer to access secrets for getting or pushing data from or to external sources such as git repo, image registry etc.
If no parameters is supplied from ClusterSupplyChain(blueprint) OR Workload(owner) then this default value is used.

label: Source repo git secret name
helperText:
the git secret you applied in the cluster.
This could also be the a parameter map from workload.

params: Source repo git secret is required

label: GitOps repo ssh git secret name
helperText:
the git secret (must be of type ssh) you applied in the cluster.
This could also be the a parameter map from workload.

params: GitOps repo git secret is required

label: Poll Interval (min)
helperText: Git repo monitor will poll from repo.

label: Default Kpack cluster builder
helperText:
Cluster builder is used to build source and produce OCI image.
If no parameters is supplied from ClusterSupplyChain(blueprint) OR Workload(owner) then this default value is used.

label: Default Dockerfile (fullpath)
helperText:
Dockerfile used to produce OCI image.
exmaple: ./Dockerfile
If no parameters is supplied from ClusterSupplyChain(blueprint) OR Workload(owner) then this default value is used.

label: Default docker build context (fullpath)
helperText:
Dockerfile used to produce OCI image.
example: ./
If no parameters is supplied from ClusterSupplyChain(blueprint) OR Workload(owner) then this default value is used.

label: Kaniko run template name
helperText:
ClusterRunTemplate used by Runnable component of this ClusterImageTemplate.
OOTB: kaniko-runtemplate
The ClusterRunTemplate can be created later on. However, it must exists for this ClusterImageTemplate to work.

params: Kaniko run template name is required

label: Tekton Task Name for Kaniko build
helperText:
The name for Tekton ClusterTask Object.
TAP OOTB ClusterTask name: kaniko-build.
If you are using Tanzu Application Platform then run kubectl get clustertask to check if cluster task already exists for this purpose. If it already exists no need to create another one. Highly recommended to re-use what already exists.

label: K8s secret for image registry
helperText:
The name of the K8s secret. The secret can be created at a later stage. BUT it must exist in the cluster and namespace for this to work.
eg: run this command to create the secret: kubectl create secret docker-registry --docker-server --docker-username --docker-password --docker-email --namespace .
If you are using Tanzu Application Platform then run kubectl get clustertask to check if cluster task already exists for this purpose. If it already exists no need to create another one. Highly recommended to re-use what already exists.

params: Docker registry credential name is required

usedin: ClusterRunTemplate - eg: kaniko-runtemplate for Runnable - this is generic enough
label: Name of ClusterTask
helperText:
example ClusterTask name: kaniko-build, trivvy-img-scanner etc.
This ClusterTask name is referenced in ClusterRunTemplate which is referenced as Runnable in ClusterImageTemplate (eg: kaniko-runtemplate, custom-scanner etc).
This ClusterTask and ClusterRunTemplate must exists for the referrer ClusterImageTemplate to work.

usedin: ClusterRunTemplate & ClusterTask - eg: scanner-template-custom, tekton-cluster-task-trivvy - this is generic enough
label: Name of Workspace
helperText:
This is the workspace name to be used in Tekton ClusterTask. For custom scanner a (k8s opaque type) secret (containing the config for scanner) is mounted as volume.
This template uses a k8s secret containing config for scanner which is not the best practice. TODO: use config map instead.
For example: a volume name 'config' of type secret is mounted in the workspace in the tekton TaskRun for Tekton ClusterTask trivvy-scanner.

label: Code Testing ClusterSourceTemplate name
helperText:
This ClusterSourceTemplate is for executing code testing. It is so heavily templated that you may be only will ever need one.
Please check if the K8s cluster already has this type of template for testing (as this comes OOTB). If so re-use that one.

label: Code Testing Run template name
helperText:
ClusterRunTemplate used by Runnable component of this testing purpose ClusterSourceTemplate. This Runnable references a ClusterRunTemplate that runs the Tekton Pipeline(kind: Pipeline) for testing source code.
OOTB: tekton-source-pipelinerun.
This template is so heavily templated that you may only ever need one.
Please check if the K8s cluster already has this type of template for running test pipeline (as this comes OOTB). If so re-use that one.

label: K8s secret name containing configs
helperText: Provide the name of the secret (type: Opaque, with stringData:) that contains the config data for the scanning tool. This is a hack. In the ClusterTask implementation the secret is treated as volume and extract the content of the config.

label: Run Template Name
helperText: ClusterRunTemplate used by Runnable component for scanning purpose. This ClusterRunTemplate (referenced in kind:Runnable) runs the Tekton ClusterTask for scanning code or image. Ensure that you choose a unique name that does not exist in this K8s cluster.

usedin: ClusterRunTemplate - eg: kaniko-runtemplate for Runnable - this is generic enough
label: Name of ClusterTask
helperText:
example ClusterTask name: kaniko-build, trivvy-img-scanner etc.
This ClusterTask name is referenced in ClusterRunTemplate which is referenced as Runnable in ClusterImageTemplate (eg: kaniko-runtemplate, custom-scanner etc).
This ClusterTask and ClusterRunTemplate must exists for the referrer ClusterImageTemplate to work.

label: K8s secret name containing trivy configs
helperText: Provide the name of the secret (type: Opaque, with stringData:) that contains the config data for the scanning tool. This is a hack. In the ClusterTask implementation the secret is treated as volume and extract the content of the config.

label: maven image
helperText: Provide the name and tag (to get from dockerhub) OR full path (to get from private registry) of the maven image that will be used to start the container inside which maven test command will be run. eg:maven:3.8.5-openjdk-18-slim, mypvt.acr.io/utils/maven:approved etc

label: test command
helperText: Provide (the 1 liner) command to run to execute test cases. eg: mvn test

label: default ssh secret for gitops
helperText: this secret is used to by cartographer task during git-push operation to access repository

label: Default Git repository server address for gitops
helperText: Note: This is default value only and can be overriden from SupplyChain (and if supplychain is also using default then value can come from workload). The server address eg: ssh://git@github.com. (Note: Just the server address. MUST NOT the entire repository address). MUST be in ssh:// url.

params: Default Git repository server address is required

label: Default Git repository owner for gitops
helperText: Note: This is default value only and can be overriden from SupplyChain (and if supplychain is also using default then value can come from workload). The owner of the repository eg: accordingtoali. Provide just the the owner name. This will form the url. Do not provide the entire url.

params: Default Git repository owner is required

label: Default Git repository name for gitops
helperText: Note: This is default value only and can be overriden from SupplyChain (and if supplychain is also using default then value can come from workload). The name of the reposiroty eg: accordingtoali. Provide just the the repository name. This will form the url. Do not provide the entire url.

params: Default Git repository name is required

label: Default Git repository branch for gitops
helperText: Note: This is default value only and can be overriden from SupplyChain (and if supplychain is also using default then value can come from workload). The branch of the reposiroty eg: main. Provide just the the repository branch. This will form the url. Do not provide the entire url.

params: Default Git repository branch is required

label: Git server host
helperText: The hostname of the git server. eg: github.com, bitbucket.org, ssh.dev.azure.com etc

label: ssh private key
helperText: The base64 private key of the ssh-key-pair generated for this git repository.

label: ssh public key
helperText: The base64 public key of the ssh-key-pair generated for this git repository. When adding to git repositority please make sure that it has push-permissions.

label: Known hosts content for git server
helperText: The base64 encoded generated content for known hosts for this git server. eg: run ssh-keyscan YOU_GIT_SERVER | base64 -w 0
